meanings.sent1: The sulcate surface of the pumpkin made it easy to carve.
meanings.sent2: The farmer admired the sulcate patterns on the plowed field.
meanings.sent3: The sulcate lines on the road looked like a giant's fingerprint.
meanings.sent4: Her sulcate fingerprints on the clay pottery added a unique touch.
meanings.sent5: The sulcate bark of the tree felt rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: To make grooves or furrows in
meanings.sent1: She used a tool to sulcate the wet clay for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The gardener decided to sulcate the garden beds for better water drainage.
meanings.sent3: The chef wanted to sulcate the dough to create a decorative pattern.
meanings.sent4: The artist carefully sulcated the wood to give it a textured look.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor planned to sulcate the marble to add depth to the sculpture.

meanings.sent1: The sulcate in the rock formation was caused by years of erosion.
meanings.sent2: Water flowed smoothly along the sulcate in the riverbed.
meanings.sent3: The child pretended the sulcate in the sand was a tiny canyon.
meanings.sent4: The sulcate in the field served as a natural pathway for rainwater.
meanings.sent5: The sulcate in the wood gave the table a rustic charm.
